g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
further livestock sector growth, with global production projected to expand by 14% by 2029, facilitated
by maintained product prices and lower feed prices
In addition to livestock, both AR5 and the SRCCL identified paddy rice cultivation as an important
the global harvested area of rice to have grown by 11% between 1990 and 2019, with total paddy
production increasing by 46%, from 519 Mt to 755 Mt
expected to limit cultivated area expansion, while die
tary shifts from rice to protein as a result of
increasing per capita income, is expected to reduce demand in certain regions, with a slight decline in
Between 1990 and 2019, Africa recorded the greatest increase (+160%) in area under rice cultivation,
followed by Asia and the Developing Pacific (+6%), with area reductions evident in all other regions
broadly corresponding with related regional CH
owth in consumption (average annual supply per capita) between 1990 and 2013
to have occurred in Eastern Europe and West Central Asia (+ 42%) followed by Africa (+ 25%), with
little change (+ 1%) observed in Asia and the Developing Pacific
e consumption is in Africa and Asia
Both AR5 and the SRCCL described considerable incr
eases in global use of synthetic nitrogen fertilisers
since the 1970s, which was identified to be a major driver of increasing N
The latest data document a 41% increase in global nitrogen fertiliser use between 1990 and 2019
O emissions (Figure 7.3). Increased fertiliser use has
been driven by pursuit of increased crop yields, with for example, a 61% in
cereal yield per hectare observed during the same period
fertiliser use and varietal improvements. Increased yields are in response to increased demand for food,
feed, fuel and fibre crops which in turn has been driven by a growing human population
increase by almost 15% over the next decade, with low income and emerging
regions with greater availability of land and labour resources expected to experience the strongest
growth, and account for about 50% of global output growth
nitrogen fertiliser use are also projected, notably in low income and emerging regions
